byline.contributor: Reporting was contributed by Omar al-Jawoshy, Falih Hassan and Ahmed Salah from Baghdad; Eric Schmitt from Washington; and an employee of The New York Times from Anbar Province.

abstract: Islamic State militants take over government sector in Ramadi, Iraq, major setback for Iraqi government and its attempts to retain control of the city.
lead_paragraph: It was premature to say that the city, capital of Anbar Province, had fallen to the Islamic State, but the advance appeared to represent a significant shift.

headline.main: ISIS Fighters Seize Government Headquarters in Ramadi, Iraq
headline.print_headline: ISIS Fighters Raise Their Flag Over Government Compound in Iraqi Province

snippet: It was premature to say that the city, capital of Anbar Province, had fallen to the Islamic State, but the advance appeared to represent a significant shift.

keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
keywords.name: organizations
